body.p: This tutorial gives you a short introduction into the Apache Lenya content management system. We'll look at a typical use case where we create a new document, edit and publish it.
It's probably best if you keep the tutorial in one browser window and open another browser window to do your first steps in Apache Lenya CMS

To create a new document goto the File->New Document menu entry. You'll get a new screen that asks you for an id and a name for this new document. The id will be used internally as an identifier for the document and the name will be used in the navigation. Let's use "foo" as id and "Foo" as the name of the new document. Now press Create. You will be redirected back to the page where you originally invoked the creation and you'll notice that the new document "Foo" now shows up as a sub-document of the Tutorial document in the navigation.
This illustrates the fact that a new document is always created as a sub-document of the document you're currently looking at. You also notice how the navigation is built automatically.

To look at the newly created document click on the "Foo" entry in the navigation. You'll notice that the "Foo" document already contains some content. It was created from a sample XML document. To change this sample content you will have to edit the document. You can pick on of the following web-based WYSIWYG editors:

ul.li: Xopus: This is a good choice for users of IE.
Bitflux: This is a good choice for users of Mozilla.
Midas: is a good choice for editing xhtml under Mozilla.

body.p: Pick your choice of editor (based on your platform) and start editing the newly created document by selecting the File->Edit with Bitflux. The Lenya menu will disappear and the Bitflux toolbar will appear instead. You can use the left mouse button to get a context sensitive menu from where you can copy, cut and paste. You're also able to insert new elements into the document from the context sensitive menu. Once you're done with all your changes, press Save&Exit to get back. You'll see your changes in the document.

Once you are satisfied with the content of the document you want to publish it to make it visible in the live area. Simply press File->Publish to publish the current document. You will get a confirmation screen where you confirm your intention to publish the document "Foo" by pressing Publish Now. You might have to publish the parent document ("Tutorial") first, as the "Foo" document will not be published if the parent document is not in the live area yet.
To check how the "Foo" document looks like in the live site click on the live tab in the Lenya menu. This will open a new browser window showing you the live site.

Apache Lenya allows you to publish a document at a specific date. To do this select the File->Publish menu entry. Now instead of pressing Publish Now, specify the date and the time at which you wish to publish the document and press Publish Later. Your document will be published at the specified date. Use the Tools->Scheduler menu entry to see the pending tasks and their status.

Every time you edit a document and exit the editor a new revision of the document is stored. Old versions of the document are kept and you can go back to an older version if you want to undo some of the changes you applied to it. To see all available versions of the current document press Tools->Rollback. This will give you a list of all previous versions. You can view a specific old version or rollback to a specific old version by clicking on the appropriate links.
